name: 蕭榮修
objective: Course Description: This course is an introduction to the computer field covering concepts of data and information, function and concepts of hardware, computer programming, operating systems, applications, communications and networks, databases, employment opportunities, and the social impact of the computer, etc. Course Objective: The goal of the course is to present an introductory survey of computer science. By exploring the breadth of the subject, the course prepares students for higher level courses such as data structures, architecture, compiler and operating system, etc. Upon completing the course, students are expected to gain broad knowledge of the most important aspects of computer science.
schedule:
1.　　Introduction
2.　　Information and Data Representation-I
3.　　Information and Data Representation-II
4.　　Hardware and Computing Components-I
5.　　Hardware and Computing Components-II
6.　　Low-Level Programming Languages
7.　　Problem Solving and Algorithms
8.　　High-Level Programming Languages
9.　　Midterm Week
10.　　Operating Systems
11.　　Information Systems: Database
12.　　Artificial Intelligence
13.　　Group Presentation (1)
14.　　Networks
15.　　Group Presentation (2)
16.　　Computer Security
17.　　Group Presentation (3)
18.　　Final Week
scorePolicy:
Grading:  
Homework: 20% 
Midterm Exam: 30% 
Final Exam: 30%
Group Presentation (including Class Participation): 20%
materials:
Textbook: Nell Dale and John Lewis, Computer Science Illuminated, 3rd Edition, Jones and Bartlett Publishers 
Reference Book: J. Glenn Brookshear, Dennis Brylow, Computer Science: An Overview, 12th, Pearson.
